response.overview: Amidst Iran's tumultuous socio-political unrest, 'No End' directed by Navid Nikkhah Azad follows Gholamali Darbari, a filmmaker whose daring exposé, 'Forced Confession,' reveals Iran's covert coercion practices. When government authorities seize his film, Darbari refuses to be silenced. Determined to challenge the Iranian government's suppression of truth amidst societal upheaval, he creates a protest selfie-video.
response.tagline: follows Gholamali Darbari, an Iranian filmmaker whose daring exposé, 'Forced Confession,' sheds light on Iran's covert coercion practices. As government authorities seize his film, Darbari refuses to be silenced.
response.title: No End
